panels.title: SQL Batch Requests Received
panels.description:
Number of batch requests received by SQL Server.
It will track the total number of batch requests over a defined period

panels.title: SQL compilations
panels.description: The number of SQL compilations per second which accumulate the total number of compilations over a specific time period

panels.title: SQL recompilations
panels.description: The number of SQL recompilations needed per second. This specify  trends and spikes in recompilation activity, which can indicate issues with query plans or caching

panels.title: SQL lock requests
panels.description: Number of lock requests resulting in a wait. This will show the total number of lock requests that have resulted in waits over a specified time period

panels.title: SQL Buffer Cache Hit Ratio
panels.description: The percentage of pages found in the buffer pool without having to read from disk

panels.title: Maximum SQL Server Connections
panels.description: Number of users connected to the SQL Server.

panels.title: Number of Active Databases
panels.description: The total number of active databases on the SQL Server instance

panels.title: Database I/O (Bytes)
panels.description: The total number of bytes of I/O operations on the database files

panels.title: Database Maximum Latency (Seconds)
panels.description: The  total time that users waited for I/O operations on the database files

panels.title: Database Operations Count
panels.description: The  total number of I/O operations issued on the database files

panels.title: Blocked Processes Count
panels.description: The number of processes that are currently blocked in SQL Server

panels.title: Throttled Read Operations Rate
panels.description: The rate of read operations that were throttled in the last second

panels.title: Throttled write Operations Rate
panels.description: The rate of write operations that were throttled in the last second

node_configs.exp: sum by(job) (system_filesystem_usage{job="$ServerName",state="used",device!~"/dev/loop.*", device!~"tmpfs|nsfs"}) / sum by(job) (system_filesystem_usage{job="$ServerName",device!~"/dev/loop.*", device!~"tmpfs|nsfs"})

panels.title: client connections
panels.description: This shows client connections and IP

variables.name: ServerName
variables.description: The server where database is hosted
